roadmap_status.details: Activation roadmap is present and deterministic (see ai_reports/phase3_activation_roadmap.json); roadmap contains pillar and global entries with inferred dependencies.

top_blockers: Missing product-level schema files for mapped products
Template-only rule registry entries lacking severity and remediation metadata
Missing per-product evaluator adapters or mappings to pipeline executor
Orphan rule_specs require ownership and reconciliation

evaluator_status.details: Pipeline executor exists but per-product adapters are required; vector and compute pillars lack per-product evaluator implementations.

schema_status.details: Product-level schema files with canonical fields are missing; templates available under ai_reports/schema_templates/*.schema.yml but not promoted.

rule_registry_status.details: Base template rules are missing required metadata (severity, remediation_hint) and there are no concrete non-template rules per product.

required_pre_activation_actions: Promote product schema templates from ai_reports/schema_templates to products/<product>/schema.yml in small PRs with CI validation (UNBLOCK-G-01 + per-product schema actions)
Update all base template rules to include `severity` and `remediation_hint`, and add at least one concrete non-template rule per product (UNBLOCK-G-02)

Implement canonical adapter mapping and per-product adapters exposing `evaluate(resource)` that invoke the pipeline executor where appropriate (UNBLOCK-G-03 + UNBLOCK-P-01, UNBLOCK-V-04, UNBLOCK-C-04)
Assign owners for orphan rule_specs and establish PR/CI promotion workflows (UNBLOCK-G-04)
Add unit/integration tests and CI checks validating executor↔adapter↔schema flow (per-pipeline testing actions)
notes: This readiness gate consolidates the activation roadmap, unblock plan, and activation gate into a single view.
Activation remains BLOCKED until schema, evaluator, and rule_registry gates are marked READY.
Recommended immediate focus: perform early-sequence schema promotions and implement the canonical adapter to reduce activation blockers.
